titleInfo.title: Quran
titleInfo.partName: Sura 1 and sura 2, section of the surat al-Kahf, colophon

mods.abstract: Complete copy of the Quran. In this eighteenth century Ottoman manuscript the text distribution of the beginning follows the model discussed above for the Quran with a Persian interlinear translation: sura 1 on the right page and the first verses of sura 2 on the left page.
mods.note: The scribe names himself in the dated colophon that follows the concluding prayer. There are no marginal notes, neither seal impressions nor ownership notes, and the cut-off date 1830-1831 (1246 HIJRA) for the binding is provided by a note on the flyfleaves at the end.

Physical Description for item from which digital images are taken: 2 endpapers 6 flyleaves: 3 at the beginning and 3 at the end neither foliation nor pagination the Quran is written on laid paper with visible regular chainlines, but the flyleaves are machine-made wove paper 19 x 13 cm rubrication illumination green cloth binding with envelope flap
M. Krek, "Islamic Manuscripts in North American Libraries: Part 5 - Union Theological Seminary Library," MELA Notes, no. 36 (Fall 1985), p. 4 s.v. 1

According to note on a piece of paper, found by M. Krek in 1983 in the manuscript, presented to the Missionary Research Library (MRL) by Rev. W. S. Nelson, D.D., of Tripoli, Syria, on 27 May 1930. William Shedd Nelson and his wife were members of the American Presbyterian Mission.
